Kassiopeia  3
Monte Carlo simulation program specializing in tracking particles in electric and magnetic fields

KSMathRKDP853.h
1 #ifndef Kassiopeia_KSMathRKDP853_h_

5 #include "KSMathMessage.h"

7 
8 /* The basis for this ODE solver is given in:
9 * "Solving Ordinary Differential Equations I: Non-stiff Problems"
10 * Hairer, Norsett, Wanner
11 * Second Revised Edition.
12 * page 181--196
13 * It is based off Hairer's implementation of the Dormand & Prince RK86 with a continuous extension
14 * and includes the coefficients of the Dormand-Prince Runge-Kutta algorithm DOP853.
15 * These coefficients have been obtained from the file dop853.c given on Hairer's website here:
16 * http://www.unige.ch/~hairer/prog/nonstiff/cprog.tar
17 * Downloaded: 8/12/15
18 * We retain the copyright and information notices below:
19 */
20 
21 /******************************************************************************/
22

50 /******************************************************************************/
51 
52 /*
53 
54 This code computes the numerical solution of a system of first order ordinary
55 differential equations y'=f(x,y). It uses an explicit Runge-Kutta method of
56 order 8(5,3) due to Dormand & Prince with step size control and dense output.
57 
58 Authors : E. Hairer & G. Wanner
59  Universite de Geneve, dept. de Mathematiques
60  CH-1211 GENEVE 4, SWITZERLAND
61  E-mail : HAIRER@DIVSUN.UNIGE.CH, WANNER@DIVSUN.UNIGE.CH
62 
63 The code is described in : E. Hairer, S.P. Norsett and G. Wanner, Solving
64 ordinary differential equations I, nonstiff problems, 2nd edition,
65 Springer Series in Computational Mathematics, Springer-Verlag (1993).
66 
67 Version of Mai 2, 1994.
68 
69 Remarks about the C version : this version allocates memory by itself, the
70 iwork array (among the initial FORTRAN parameters) has been splitted into
71 independant initial parameters, the statistical variables and last step size
72 and x have been encapsulated in the module and are now accessible through
73 dedicated functions; the variable names have been kept to maintain a kind
74 of reading compatibility between the C and FORTRAN codes; adaptation made by
75 J.Colinge (COLINGE@DIVSUN.UNIGE.CH).
76 */
77 
78 /******************************************************************************/
79 
80 #include <limits>
81 #include <cmath>
82 
83 #include "KSMathIntegrator.h"
84 
85 
86 #define KSMATHRKDP853_STAGE 12
87 #define KSMATHRKDP853_INTERP_STAGE 16
88 #define KSMATHRKDP853_EXTENDED_STAGE 3
89 #define KSMATHRKDP853_INTERP_ORDER 8
90 
91 namespace Kassiopeia
92 {
93 
94  template< class XSystemType >
95  class KSMathRKDP853 :
96  public KSMathIntegrator< XSystemType >
97  {
98  public:
99  KSMathRKDP853();
100  virtual ~KSMathRKDP853();
101 
102  public:
103  typedef XSystemType SystemType;
104  typedef KSMathDifferentiator< SystemType > DifferentiatorType;
105  typedef typename SystemType::ValueType ValueType;
106  typedef typename SystemType::DerivativeType DerivativeType;
107  typedef typename SystemType::ErrorType ErrorType;
108 
109  public:
110  virtual void Integrate( double aTime,
111  const DifferentiatorType& aTerm,
112  const ValueType& anInitialValue,
113  const double& aStep,
114  ValueType& aFinalValue,
115  ErrorType& anError ) const;
116 
117 
118  /*******************************************************************/
119  virtual void ClearState()
120  {
121  fHaveCachedDerivative = false;
122  };
123 
124  //returns true if information valid
125  virtual bool GetInitialDerivative(DerivativeType& derv) const
126  {
127  if(fHaveCachedDerivative)
128  {
129  derv = fDerivatives[0]; return true;
130  }
131  return false;
132  };
133 
134  //returns true if information valid
135  virtual bool GetFinalDerivative(DerivativeType& derv) const
136  {
137  if(fHaveCachedDerivative)
138  {
139  derv = fDerivatives[KSMATHRKDP853_STAGE]; return true;
140  }
141  return false;
142  };
143 
144  //these functions are provided if the integrator implements
145  //a method to interpolate the solution between initial and final step values
146  //only valid for interpolating values on the last integration step
147  virtual bool HasDenseOutput() const {return true;};
148  virtual void Interpolate(double aStepFraction, ValueType& aValue) const;
149 
150  /******************************************************************/
151 
152  private:
153 
154  mutable bool fHaveCachedDerivative;
155  mutable double fIntermediateTime[ KSMATHRKDP853_INTERP_STAGE ];
156  mutable ValueType fValues[ KSMATHRKDP853_INTERP_STAGE ];
157  mutable ValueType fDenseTerms[ KSMATHRKDP853_INTERP_ORDER ];
158  mutable DerivativeType fDerivatives[ KSMATHRKDP853_INTERP_STAGE ];
159 
160  mutable ValueType yerr;
161  mutable ValueType y8;
162 
163  //parameters defining the Butcher Tableau and dense output stages and interpolant
164  static const double fA[ KSMATHRKDP853_STAGE ][ KSMATHRKDP853_STAGE];
165  static const double fAExtended[ KSMATHRKDP853_EXTENDED_STAGE ][ KSMATHRKDP853_INTERP_STAGE ];
166  static const unsigned int fAColumnLimit[KSMATHRKDP853_INTERP_STAGE];
167 
168  static const double fB8[ KSMATHRKDP853_STAGE ];
169  static const double fBhh[3];
170  static const double fBErr[ KSMATHRKDP853_STAGE ];
171  static const double fC[ KSMATHRKDP853_INTERP_STAGE ];
172  static const double fD4[ KSMATHRKDP853_INTERP_STAGE ];
173  static const double fD5[ KSMATHRKDP853_INTERP_STAGE ];
174  static const double fD6[ KSMATHRKDP853_INTERP_STAGE ];
175  static const double fD7[ KSMATHRKDP853_INTERP_STAGE ];
176 
177  };
178 
179  template< class XSystemType >
180  KSMathRKDP853< XSystemType >::KSMathRKDP853()
181  {
182  for(unsigned int i=0; i<KSMATHRKDP853_STAGE; i++)
183  {
184  fIntermediateTime[i] = std::numeric_limits<double>::quiet_NaN();
185  fValues[i] = std::numeric_limits<double>::quiet_NaN();
186  fDerivatives[i] = std::numeric_limits<double>::quiet_NaN();
187  }
188  fHaveCachedDerivative = false;
189  }
190 
191  template< class XSystemType >
192  KSMathRKDP853< XSystemType >::~KSMathRKDP853()
193  {
194  }
195 
196  template< class XSystemType >
197  void KSMathRKDP853< XSystemType >::Integrate(double aTime, const DifferentiatorType& aTerm, const ValueType& anInitialValue, const double& aStep, ValueType& aFinalValue, ErrorType& anError ) const
198  {
199  //do first stage (0) explicitly to deal with possibility of cached data
200  //init value and time
201  fValues[0] = anInitialValue;
202  fIntermediateTime[0] = aTime;
203 
204 
205 
206 
207  //init solution estimates
208  ValueType y8 = fValues[0];
209 
210  // for(unsigned int i=0; i<ValueType::sDimension; i++)
211  // {
212  // mathmsg_debug( "rkdp853 y[" << 0 <<"]["<<i<<"] = "<<fValues[0][i]<< eom );
213  // }
214 
215  //we check if we have cached the derivative from the last step
216  if( fHaveCachedDerivative )
217  {
218  fDerivatives[0] = fDerivatives[KSMATHRKDP853_STAGE];
219  }
220  else
221  {
222  aTerm.Differentiate( fIntermediateTime[0], fValues[0], fDerivatives[0] );
223  }
224 
225  // for(unsigned int i=0; i<ValueType::sDimension; i++)
226  // {
227  // mathmsg_debug( "rkdp853 derv[" << 0 <<"]["<<i<<"] = "<<fDerivatives[0][i]<< eom );
228  // }
229 
230  //add contribution to 8th order estimate
231  y8 = y8 + aStep*fB8[0]*fDerivatives[0];
232 
233  //compute the value of each stage and
234  //evaluation of the derivative at each stage
235  for(unsigned int i=1; i<KSMATHRKDP853_STAGE; i++)
236  {
237  //compute the time of this stage
238  fIntermediateTime[i] = fIntermediateTime[0] + aStep*fC[i];
239 
240  //now compute the stage value
241  fValues[i] = fValues[0];
242  for(unsigned int j=0; j<fAColumnLimit[i]; j++)
243  {
244  fValues[i] = fValues[i] + (aStep*fA[i][j])*fDerivatives[j];
245  }
246 
247  // for(unsigned int j=0; j<ValueType::sDimension; j++)
248  // {
249  // mathmsg_debug( "rkdp853 y[" << i <<"]["<<j<<"] = "<<fValues[i][j]<< eom );
250  // }
251 
252 
253  //now compute the derivative term for this stage
254  aTerm.Differentiate(fIntermediateTime[i], fValues[i], fDerivatives[i]);
255 
256 
257  // for(unsigned int j=0; j<ValueType::sDimension; j++)
258  // {
259  // mathmsg_debug( "rkdp853 derv[" << i <<"]["<<j<<"] = "<<fDerivatives[i][j]<< eom );
260  // }
261 
262  //add contribution to 8th order estimate
263  y8 = y8 + aStep*fB8[i]*fDerivatives[i];
264  }
265 
266  //we use the 8th order estimate for the solution (extrapolation)
267  aFinalValue = y8;
268 
269  // for(unsigned int j=0; j<ValueType::sDimension; j++)
270  // {
271  // mathmsg_debug( "rkdp853 y_final["<<j<<"] = "<<y8[j]<< eom );
272  // }
273 
274  //now estimate the truncation error on the step (for stepsize control)
275  yerr = 0.0;
276  for(unsigned int i=0; i<KSMATHRKDP853_STAGE; i++)
277  {
278  yerr = yerr + fBErr[i]*fDerivatives[i];
279  }
280  anError = aStep*yerr;
281 
282  // for(unsigned int j=0; j<ValueType::sDimension; j++)
283  // {
284  // mathmsg_debug( "rkdp853 y_err["<<j<<"] = "<<yerr[j]<< eom );
285  // }
286 
287  //evaluate the derivative at final point and cache it for the next
288  //step (this derivative is also needed for the dense output interpolation)
289  fIntermediateTime[KSMATHRKDP853_STAGE] = aTime + aStep;
290  fValues[KSMATHRKDP853_STAGE] = aFinalValue;
291  aTerm.Differentiate( fIntermediateTime[KSMATHRKDP853_STAGE], aFinalValue, fDerivatives[KSMATHRKDP853_STAGE] );
292  fHaveCachedDerivative = true;
293 
294  // for(unsigned int j=0; j<ValueType::sDimension; j++)
295  // {
296  // mathmsg_debug( "rkdp853 y_final_derv["<<j<<"] = "<<fDerivatives[KSMATHRKDP853_STAGE][j]<< eom );
297  // }
298 
299  //evaluate the extra derivatives needed for the 7th order dense output
300  for(unsigned int i=13; i<KSMATHRKDP853_INTERP_STAGE; i++)
301  {
302  //compute the time of this stage
303  fIntermediateTime[i] = fIntermediateTime[0] + aStep*fC[i];
304 
305  //now compute the stage value
306  fValues[i] = fValues[0];
307  for(unsigned int j=0; j<fAColumnLimit[i]; j++)
308  {
309  fValues[i] = fValues[i] + (aStep*fAExtended[i-13][j])*fDerivatives[j];
310  }
311 
312  // for(unsigned int j=0; j<ValueType::sDimension; j++)
313  // {
314  // mathmsg_debug( "rkdp853 y_ext[" << i <<"]["<<j<<"] = "<<fValues[i][j]<< eom );
315  // }
316 
317  //now compute the derivative term for this stage
318  aTerm.Differentiate(fIntermediateTime[i], fValues[i], fDerivatives[i]);
319 
320  // for(unsigned int j=0; j<ValueType::sDimension; j++)
321  // {
322  // mathmsg_debug( "rkdp853 derv_ext[" << i <<"]["<<j<<"] = "<<fDerivatives[i][j]<< eom );
323  // }
324  }
325 
326  //now we make the dense term evaluations for the continuous output
327  fDenseTerms[0] = fValues[0];
328  fDenseTerms[1] = fValues[KSMATHRKDP853_STAGE] - fValues[0];
329  fDenseTerms[2] = aStep*fDerivatives[0] - fDenseTerms[1];
330  fDenseTerms[3] = fDenseTerms[1] - aStep*fDerivatives[KSMATHRKDP853_STAGE] - fDenseTerms[2];
331  fDenseTerms[4] = 0.0; fDenseTerms[5] = 0.0; fDenseTerms[6] = 0.0; fDenseTerms[7] = 0.0;
332  for(unsigned int i=0; i<KSMATHRKDP853_INTERP_STAGE; i++)
333  {
334  DerivativeType sderv = fDerivatives[i];
335  sderv = aStep*sderv;
336  fDenseTerms[4] = fDenseTerms[4] + fD4[i]*sderv;
337  fDenseTerms[5] = fDenseTerms[5] + fD5[i]*sderv;
338  fDenseTerms[6] = fDenseTerms[6] + fD6[i]*sderv;
339  fDenseTerms[7] = fDenseTerms[7] + fD7[i]*sderv;
340  }
341  return;
342  }
343 
344  template< class XSystemType >
345  void KSMathRKDP853< XSystemType >::Interpolate(double aStepFraction, ValueType& aValue) const
346  {
347  double s = aStepFraction;
348  double s1 = 1.0 - s;
349  aValue = 0.0;
350  for(unsigned int i=KSMATHRKDP853_INTERP_ORDER-1; i > 0; i--)
351  {
352  double x;
353  if(i%2 == 1){x = s;}
354  else{x = s1;}
355 
356  aValue = aValue + fDenseTerms[i];
357  aValue = x*aValue;
358  }
359  aValue = aValue + fDenseTerms[0];
360  }
361 
362  template< class XSystemType >
363  const double KSMathRKDP853< XSystemType >::fC[KSMATHRKDP853_INTERP_STAGE] =
364  {
365  0.0, //c1
366  0.526001519587677318785587544488E-01, //c2
367  0.789002279381515978178381316732E-01, //c3
368  0.118350341907227396726757197510E+00, //c4
369  0.281649658092772603273242802490E+00, //c5
370  0.333333333333333333333333333333E+00, //c6
371  0.25E+00, //c7
372  0.307692307692307692307692307692E+00, //c8
373  0.651282051282051282051282051282E+00, //c9
374  0.6E+00, //c10
375  0.857142857142857142857142857142E+00, //c11
376  1.0, //c12
377  1.0, //c13
378  0.1E+00, //c14
379  0.2E+00, //c15
380  0.777777777777777777777777777778E+00 //c16
381  };

442  template< class XSystemType >
443  const double KSMathRKDP853< XSystemType >::fD4[KSMATHRKDP853_INTERP_STAGE] =
444  {
445  -0.84289382761090128651353491142E+01,
446  0.0,
447  0.0,
